org.opends.quicksetup.installer

Class Installer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.quicksetup.Application
      • org.opends.quicksetup.ui.GuiApplication
        • org.opends.quicksetup.installer.Installer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, ProgressNotifier

    public class Installer
extends GuiApplication
    This is an abstract class that is in charge of actually performing the installation. It just takes a UserData object and based on that installs OpenDJ. When there is an update during the installation it will notify the ProgressUpdateListener objects that have been added to it. The notification will send a ProgressUpdateEvent. This class is supposed to be fully independent of the graphical layout. Note that we can use freely the class org.opends.server.util.SetupUtils as it is included in quicksetup.jar.

      • isCancellable

        public boolean isCancellable()
        Description copied from class: Application
        Indicates whether this application is capable of cancelling the operation performed in the run method. A cancellable operation should leave its environment in the same state as it was prior to running the operation (files deleted, changes backed out etc.). Marking an Application as cancellable may control UI elements like the presense of a cancel button while the operation is being performed. Applications marked as cancellable should override the cancel method in such a way as to undo whatever actions have taken place in the run method up to that point.
        Specified by:
        isCancellable in class Application
        Returns:
        boolean where true inidcates that the operation is cancellable

      • getOrderedSteps

        public LinkedHashSet<WizardStep> getOrderedSteps()
        Description copied from class: GuiApplication
        Returns the list of all the steps in an ordered manner. This is required because in the case of an application with substeps the user of the other interfaces is not enough. This is a default implementation that uses the getNextWizardStep method to calculate the list that work for applications with no substeps.
        Overrides:
        getOrderedSteps in class GuiApplication
        Returns:
        a list containing ALL the steps (including substeps) in an ordered manner.

      • checkAbort

        public void checkAbort()
                throws ApplicationException
        Checks the value of canceled field and throws an ApplicationException if true. This indicates that the user has canceled this operation and the process of aborting should begin as soon as possible.
        Overrides:

                    throws UserDataException

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • initializeSuffix

        public void initializeSuffix(ConnectionWrapper conn,
                             int replicaServerId,
                             DN suffixDn,
                             boolean displayProgress,
                             HostPort sourceServerDisplay)
                      throws ApplicationException,
                             PeerNotFoundException
        Initializes a suffix with the contents of a replica that has a given replication id.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection to the server whose suffix we want to initialize.
        replicaServerId - the server ID of the replica we want to use to initialize the contents of the suffix.
        suffixDn - the dn of the suffix.
        displayProgress - whether we want to display progress or not.
        sourceServerDisplay - the string to be used to represent the server that contains the data that will be used to initialize the suffix.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - if an unexpected error occurs.
        PeerNotFoundException - if the replication mechanism cannot find a peer.

      • applicationPrintStreamReceived

        protected void applicationPrintStreamReceived(String message)
        Description copied from class: Application
        Method that is invoked by the printstreams with the messages received on operations such as start or import. This is done so that the application can parse this messages and display them.
        Overrides:
        applicationPrintStreamReceived in class Application
        Parameters:
        message - the message that has been received
